hint.text: Substitute and solve the n^th term for n=1,2,3,4,5

solution.text:
Substitute and solve the n^th term for n=1,2,3,4,5
\( a_1= \frac{_{p}_\times 1-_{q}_}{_{r}_}=_{{Fraction(p*1-q,r)}}_ =_{{trunc(Decimal(p*1-q)/(r),3)}}_\)
\( a_2= \frac{_{p}_\times 2-_{q}_}{_{r}_}=_{{Fraction(p*2-q,r)}}_ =_{{trunc(Decimal(p*2-q)/(r),3)}}_\)
\( a_3= \frac{_{p}_\times 3-_{q}_}{_{r}_}=_{{Fraction(p*3-q,r)}}_ =_{{trunc(Decimal(p*3-q)/(r),3)}}_ \)
\( a_4= \frac{_{p}_\times 4-_{q}_}{_{r}_}=_{{Fraction(p*4-q,r)}}_ = _{{trunc(Decimal(p*4-q)/(r),3)}}_ \)
\( a_5= \frac{_{p}_\times 5-_{q}_}{_{r}_}=_{{Fraction(p*5-q,r)}}_ = _{{trunc(Decimal(p*5-q)/(r),3)}}_\)

content.text: Find first five terms of the sequence whose n^th term is\( a_n= \frac{_{p}_\times n-_{q}_}{_{r}_}\)
